page.title: 10THE COMMONWEALTH SMELTER
page.content: The Smelting Works in Avonmouth is the {only primary zinc producer}in Great Britain. Production of zinc at Avonmouth began in 1928. Today the Smelter covers approximately 25 hectares and employs about 700 people from the surrounding areas.{Zinc, lead and{mixed ore concentrates}are unloaded at nearby Avonmouth Docks and fed onto the mile-long{conveyor}system before going into the Smelting process. The C.S.L.{blast furnace}is the largest of its kind in the world and the process is largely controlled by{computer.}Products manufactured here are vital in industry and for producing items in everyday commercial and domestic use, including{zinc, {lead, bullion, cadmium. copper}and {sulphuric acid.}Â£1,000,000 a year are spent on health, enviromental and safety aspects of the plant.
